alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 5:35AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...Strong gusty winds and blowing snow in Homer today... Southwest winds of 15 to 30 mph with gusts of 30 to 40 mph will develop in Homer and vicinity during the mid to late morning hours, then persist through the afternoon hours. This will result in areas of blowing and drifting snow, with localized low visibilities. Also expect some snow showers to develop over the area. While these showers are not expected to be very heavy or persistent, any falling snow will combine with the winds to more severely limit visibilities. Winds and snow showers will both diminish heading into the evening hours, though southwest gusts to 25 mph will linger all the way through late tonight.
